article.title: Ensemble of heterogeneous flexible neural trees using multiobjective genetic programming

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary objective of the Differential Evolution (DE) phase in the co-evolutionary construction of the heterogeneous flexible neural tree?
choices: To construct a tree-like structure for the HFNT.
To optimize the tree structure by selecting activation functions and input features.
To fine-tune the underlying parameters of a selected fixed HFNT structure.
To determine if the current solution is satisfactory based on the termination criteria.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the leaf nodes in Figure 2 represent?
choices: Weights associated with the edges of the tree.
The final output of the neural tree.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the variable *n<sub>i</sub>* in Figure 3 represent?
choices: The number of output connections from the *i*-th node.
The number of inputs and weights received at the *i*-th node.
The index of the activation function used at the *i*-th node.
The weight associated with the connection to the *i*-th node.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the Pareto-front line in Figure 4(b) illustrate?
choices: The trade-off between approximation error and diversity index while keeping tree size constant.
Solutions with the lowest approximation error regardless of tree size and diversity index.
The set of solutions that represent the best trade-off between approximation error and tree size, or approximation error and diversity index.
The optimal solution that simultaneously minimizes approximation error, tree size, and maximizes diversity index.
